api/services.title: Services API Reference
api/services.description: This document describes the services currently available in Fluttron.

api/web-views.title: Web Views API Reference
api/web-views.description: This document describes the Web View APIs available in Fluttron for embedding Web content into Flutter Web applications.

architecture/bridge-communication.title: Bridge Communication
architecture/bridge-communication.description: Bridge communication is the IPC mechanism between Host and Renderer using flutter_inappwebview JavaScript handlers.

architecture/host-layer.title: Host Layer
architecture/host-layer.description: The Host layer is a Flutter Desktop application that exposes native services and loads the Renderer in a WebView.

architecture/overview.title: Architecture Overview
architecture/overview.description: Fluttron uses a dual-layer model: a native Host (Flutter Desktop) and a Renderer (Flutter Web) running inside a WebView.

architecture/renderer-layer.title: Renderer Layer
architecture/renderer-layer.description: The Renderer layer is a Flutter Web application running inside the Host WebView.

examples/hello-world.title: Hello World Example
examples/hello-world.description: This example uses the CLI template and the built-in demo UI.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: This guide sets up Fluttron for local development on macOS (initial focus).

getting-started/project-structure.title: Project Structure
getting-started/project-structure.description: Fluttron is a monorepo plus a project template generated by the CLI.

getting-started/quick-start.title: Quick Start
getting-started/quick-start.description: This guide creates and runs a Fluttron app using the CLI.

intro.title: intro
intro.description: Fluttron is a Dart-native cross-platform container OS.
